marker.ph: /// The class that all items should inherit from ...
/// Sets what this trigger will fire ...
/// Sets whether ot not this trigger will fire ...
/// Sets whether ot not this trigger will go inactive when fired once ...
/// This method is run by PlayerMain when the player hits an object with this code as component ...
/// The class that all items should inherit from ...
/// Base function to be overriden by specific object that inherits from this, fired by its trigger. ...
/// The time the trigger was activated ...
/// Event overriding base Triggerable method is fired by the trigger ...
/// Event overriding base Triggerable method is fired by the trigger ...
/* If the player's been defined and that's not what we hit, and it's not a trigger, then it must be the ground. ... */
/// Event overriding base Triggerable method is fired by the trigger ...
/* Add the correct amount of force for a full jump: ... */
/// whether the player has pressed melee button ...
/// Whether or not the player is on the ground ...
/// Whether or not the player is jumping ...
/// Runs every frame. Handles input for the player character here. ...
/// Damages the player by the given amount ...
/// Only to be called within Player class, runs nessecary procedure to kill player ...
/// Returns wether or not the player is dead. Read only. ...
/// Method to retrieve an item from inventory using a name ...
/// Method to add an item to inventory ...
/// Method to remove an item from the inventory via item name ...
/// Method to remove an item from the inventory via item object ...
/// Method to check if item is in inventory using a name ...
/// Method to check if item is in inventory using the item itself ...
/// Hard tracks the player by centering them on the screen (+offset) ...
/// The player can push the screen around by walking into the boundaries ...
/// When the player hits a boundary the camera will move to center on them (+offset) ...
/// Leaves the camera at a screen position ...
/// Boolean describing Whether or not the camera will run ...
/// Whether ot not the camera is currently snapping ...
/// The camera type settings describes which behaviour the camera will display ...
/// Points to what the camera should track ...
/// Sets the offset from the target ...
/// Whether or not the camera is shaking ...
/// The length of a shake, from 0-1 (shake is multiplied by - Shake length every frame) ...
/// The position of the camera for the screen behaviour ...
/// The boundaries for push and snap behaviours (w is left, x is right, y is up, z is down) ...
/// How much the camera is smoothed when moving to track the target - should be high for good smooth snap behavio ...
/// Overrides the update method of the Item, so that Unity's monobehaviour runs this ...
/// Overriding method to describe behaviour on collectable pickup ...
/// Runs every frame. Handles input for the player character here. ...
/// Damages the player by the given amount ...

/// Returns wether or not the player is dead. Read only. ...
